title: Morocco quietly marks three years of normalization with Israel
summary: The war in Gaza is increasing tensions between Rabat and Tel Aviv, but this has not affected the two countries' security partnership – much to the displeasure of public opinion.

title: 'Tonight our hearts are in Bethlehem,' says Pope Francis in Christmas mass
summary: The pontiff has frequently denounced attacks on civilians in the ongoing conflict.

title: The Rambouillet château, the secretive retreat of French leaders
summary: Until 2018, the castle was reserved for sitting presidents. Now, it has been returned to the public and is open to visitors. Welcome to the corridors of power.

title: Investigators question Indian passengers grounded in France over trafficking fears
summary: Prosecutors expect the grounded Legend Airlines plane and 303 passengers will be allowed to leave Monday. They have been held since Thursday at Vatry airport.

title: Pro-Russian interference campaign targets Moldova on Facebook
summary: A high-budget influence operation revealed by the NGO Reset promoted pro-Russian candidates in local elections and has broadcast messages glorifying Ilan Shor, an exiled pro-Russian oligarch.

title: 'Rising tide of Chinese caviar destabilizing markets'
summary: China is the leading producer of the precious sturgeon eggs, leaving Italy and France far behind. Today, caviar is coming from everywhere except Russia, explains 'Le Monde' economics writer Laurence Girard.

title: Chad's new constitution passes with 86% of vote
summary: The referendum is a key step in the return to civilian rule by end-2024 promised by the military leaders.

title: Hundreds try to storm Belgrade city hall, allege electoral fraud in parliamentary elections
summary: A team of international observers has reported 'vote buying' and 'ballot box stuffing' in the December 17 vote.

title: War in Ukraine puts Russia on the defensive in the post-Soviet space
summary: Since Russia's invasion of Ukraine, former Soviet republics have been asserting their sovereignty and rapprochement with Europe is gathering pace, but the spectre of Russia remains.

title: Under the bombs, famine looms in Gaza
summary: According to the World Food Program, 93% of Gazans are now in 'acute food insecurity.' On Friday, a United Nations Security Council resolution called for the delivery of humanitarian aid to the enclave 'at scale.'

title: Billionaire Jim Ratcliffe agrees deal to buy 25% of Manchester United
summary: The chairman of INEOS will also provide $300 million for future investment in the Premier League club's stadium, Old Trafford.

title: Maia Sandu, Moldova's pro-EU president, will seek second term
summary: In a post on Facebook, Sandu said she would run in the 2024 election.

title: Chinese single mothers on their tough journey: 'I can live without being married, but not without having children'
summary: In China, laws and attitudes are changing, and some women are choosing to raise their children alone. But medically assisted reproduction is reserved for married couples, forcing single people to resort to clinics abroad.

title: Police arrest second man after Banksy stop sign theft in London
summary: A stop sign featuring three military drones by the street artist was stolen hours after it was put on Friday.

title: Why does this bird never stop singing?
summary: Researchers have discovered that male zebra finches need to exercise every day to maintain their performance skills.

title: The 30-euro festive menu from Michelin-starred chef Bruno Verjus
summary: On a tight budget, can you make the most of what you find in a French supermarket to prepare a top-quality meal for four people? Bruno Verjus, the chef at Table, in Paris, took up the challenge.

title: What's in France's controversial immigration law?
summary: Parliament adopted on Tuesday night a law on immigration that was described as an 'ideological victory' by far-right leader Marine Le Pen.

title: Le Monde's top 10 destinations | #4 Switzerland's Aletsch Glacier
summary: Where to travel in 2024? This year, Le Monde answers that question with 10 travel picks accessible by train from France. Discover two travel guides per week throughout December. Number 4: Europe's largest glacier, the Aletsch.

title: Bethlehem's Christmas celebrations are muted, in solidarity with Gaza
summary: The West Bank town, which is 40% Christian, is empty of tourists and pilgrims. It has been partly sealed off by Israeli authorities. There will be no festivities, other than masses.

title: 68 killed in single Israeli airstrike on Gaza
summary: The strike targeted the al-Maghazi refugee camp in central Gaza. The victims include 12 women and seven children.

title: Immigration law: African students' mobility increasingly restricted
summary: The text restricts conditions for arriving and staying in France, and should also make it impossible to waive tuition fees, which were sharply increased in 2019.

title: In Chambéry, locals and foreign students unite for a shared Christmas: 'I didn't even know the capital of Kazakhstan'
summary: For the past 15 years, the city of Chambéry and the Université Savoie-Mont-Blanc have been inviting local residents to welcome foreign students and celebrate Christmas together, meeting new people and discovering new cultures.

title: Oyster farming revolution on the small island of Kumejima in Japan
summary: With a view to offering oysters without the risk of food poisoning, General Oyster has developed a technique for the crustacean's onshore production. This world first is based on the use of water drawn from the depths of the ocean.

title: Jean Pisani-Ferry: After COP28, 'the alarms raised by climate activists remain entirely justified'
summary: In his column, the economist explains how international climate negotiations have led to the emergence of 'green' capitalism, which places its bets on the development of clean technologies.

title: How Napoleon is helping Moët & Chandon sell champagne
summary: Napoleon Bonaparte was a champagne connoisseur who visited the 'grande maison' on many occasions, and the house has sustained the connection ever since.

title: In the footsteps of Jesus 'beyond the Jordan': How Jordan wants to attract Christians
summary: Jordan plans to develop Christian pilgrimages and tourism on its soil, laying claim to emblematic biblical sites such as the presumed site of Christ's baptism and Mount Nebo.

title: At Christmas mass in Bethlehem, calls for 'the end of hostilities' in Gaza
summary: The Latin patriarch of Jerusalem celebrated the Nativity in a city marked by the ongoing war in Gaza. Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has announced strikes on the Palestinian enclave will 'intensify.'

title: Plane grounded in France set to return passengers to India
summary: The plane that was supposed to carry 303 Indian passengers from Dubai to Nicaragua will fly to Mumbai, after spending four days grounded in France over concerns of possible human trafficking. Two passengers are still detained and may face charges.

title: Navalny moved to Russian Arctic penal colony, says spokesperson
summary: Jailed opposition leader Alexei Navalny, whose whereabouts were unknown for three weeks, is Kharp in the Yamalo-Nenets Autonomous District, according to his associates.

title: 'The situation on the Mexico border has become a Republican rallying cry: America First'
summary: The Republican Party is opposing aid for Ukraine without prior agreement on immigration. Domestic polarization between Republicans and Democrats is undermining US credibility, writes Le Monde columnist Alain Frachon.

title: Pope Francis deplores Gaza's 'desperate' situation in Christmas message
summary: Francis spoke of conflicts around the world in his traditional 'Urbi et Orbi' call for peace.
